{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2015}} {{Portuguese name|Gonçalves|Miranda}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Roderick |image = |fullname = Roderick Jefferson Gonçalves Miranda |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|3|30|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Odivelas]], Portugal |height = {{height|m=1.92}} |position = [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|Centre back]] |currentclub = [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]]
(on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]) |clubnumber = 25 |youthyears1 = 1999–2000 | youthclubs1 = [[Odivelas F.C.|Odivelas]] |youthyears2 = 2000–2010 | youthclubs2 = [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] |years1 = 2010–2013 | clubs1 = [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] | caps1 = 7 | goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2011–2012 | clubs2 = → [[Servette FC|Servette]] (loan) | caps2 = 24 | goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2012 | clubs3 = → [[Deportivo de La Coruña|Deportivo La Coruña]] (loan) | caps3 = 3 | goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2012–2013 | clubs4 = [[S.L. Benfica B|Benfica B]] | caps4 = 5 | goals4 = 0 |years5 = 2013–2017 | clubs5 = [[Rio Ave F.C.|Rio Ave]] | caps5 = 72 | goals5 = 4 |years6 = 2017– | clubs6 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] | caps6 = 17 | goals6 = 0 |years7 = 2018– | clubs7 = → [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] (loan) | caps7 = 6 | goals7 = 0 |nationalyears1 = 2007 | nationalteam1 = [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2008 | nationalteam2 = [[Portugal national under-18 football team|Portugal U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 0 |nationalyears3 = 2008–2010 | nationalteam3 = [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 22 | nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam4 = [[Portugal national under-20 football team|Portugal U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 14 | nationalgoals4 = 0 |club-update = 21:26, 25 February 2019 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = }} '''Roderick Jefferson Gonçalves Miranda''' (born 30 March 1991), known simply as '''Roderick''', is a Portuguese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]] for Greek club [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] from English club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. ==Club career== ===Benfica=== Born in [[Odivelas]], Roderick arrived in [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]]'s youth academy in 2000 (aged nine), from [[Lisbon]] neighbours [[Odivelas F.C.|Odivelas]]. He was promoted to the first team nine years later after having played in all the youth ranks of the [[Primeira Liga]] giants, and appeared in some pre-season and [[Taça da Liga]] matches in [[2009–10 Primeira Liga|his debut campaign]]. For [[2011–12 Swiss Super League|2011–12]], Roderick was loaned to [[Servette FC|Servette]] in [[Switzerland]] – coached by former Benfica player [[João Resende Alves|João Alves]] – in a [[2011–12 Swiss Super League|season]]-long move.{{cite web|url=http://www.sabado.pt/ultima-hora/detalhe/Roderick--%C2%ABO-inicio-de-uma-grande-carreira%C2%BB|title=Roderick: "O início de uma grande carreira"|trans-title=Roderick: «The start of a great career»|publisher=[[Sábado (magazine)|Sábado]]|language=pt|date=12 November 2011|accessdate=16 April 2018}} On 31 July 2012 he joined [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] in [[La Liga]], in the same situation; he returned to the [[Estádio da Luz]] in the following [[transfer window]], however.{{cite news|url=http://www.lavozdegalicia.es/noticia/deportivo/2012/12/28/roderick-deja-deportivo/00031356713455346285110.htm|title=Roderick deja el Deportivo|trans-title=Roderick leaves Deportivo|newspaper=[[La Voz de Galicia]]|language=es|date=28 December 2012|accessdate=13 February 2014}} ===Rio Ave=== Roderick was released by Benfica in August 2013, signing a five-year deal with [[Rio Ave F.C.|Rio Ave]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rioave-fc.pt/noticias/verdetalhes.php?registo=2999|title=Roderick assinou por 5 épocas|trans-title=Roderick signed for 5 seasons|publisher=Rio Ave F.C|language=pt|date=3 August 2013|accessdate=3 August 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130807011011/http://www.rioave-fc.pt/noticias/verdetalhes.php?registo=2999|archivedate=7 August 2013|df=dmy-all}} He scored three goals in 33 games in [[2016–17 Primeira Liga|his fourth season]],{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/noticias/interior/moreirense-rio-ave-empate-com-final-de-loucos-5458848.html|title=Moreirense-Rio Ave: empate com final de loucos|trans-title=Moreirense-Rio Ave: draw with crazy ending|newspaper=[[O Jogo]]|language=pt|date=23 October 2016|accessdate=14 June 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cdnacional.pt/nacional-derrotado-vila-do-conde/|title=Nacional derrotado em Vila do Conde|trans-title=Nacional defeated in Vila do Conde|publisher=C.D. Nacional|language=pt|date=18 December 2016|accessdate=16 April 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rtp.pt/noticias/desporto/ao-minuto-fc-porto-rio-ave_e977537|title=FC Porto 4–2 Rio Ave|publisher=[[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]]|language=pt|date=21 January 2017|accessdate=14 June 2017}} helping to a seventh-place finish. ===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 13 June 2017, Roderick joined [[EFL Championship|English Championship]] team [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a four-year contract for an undisclosed fee.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40268288|title=Roderick Miranda: Wolves sign Rio Ave defender on four-year deal|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 June 2017|accessdate=12 July 2018}} He made his debut on 5 August, playing the whole of a 1–0 home win against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]],{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40760787|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 1–0 Middlesbrough|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 August 2017|accessdate=12 July 2018}} Roderick continued in the league team for 14 matches, before falling out of favour with manager [[Nuno Espírito Santo]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2018/04/04/do-has-nuno-indicated-that-danny-batth-wont-be-at-wolves-next-se/|title=Has Nuno indicated that Danny Batth will not be at Wolves next season?|publisher=HITC|first=Danny|last=Owen|date=4 April 2018|accessdate=16 July 2018}} He finished [[2017–18 EFL Championship|the season]] with 19 appearances in all competitions,{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/transfer/news/11699/11434633/prince-oniangue-leaves-for-caen-wolves-loan-out-roderick-miranda|title=Prince Oniangue leaves for Caen, Wolves loan out Roderick Miranda|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|first=Matthew|last=Treadwell|date=12 July 2018|accessdate=16 July 2018}} as Wolves were promoted as champions.{{cite news|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2018/07/11/roderick-miranda-thanks-wolves-after-sealing-loan-exit/|title=Roderick Miranda thanks Wolves after sealing loan exit|newspaper=[[Express & Star]]|first=Tim|last=Spiers|location=Wolverhampton|date=11 July 2018|accessdate=12 July 2018}} ===Olympiacos=== On 11 July 2018, Roderick joined [[Greek Superleague]] club [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] on a season-long loan.{{cite web|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/first-team/20180711-miranda-joins-olympiacos/|title=Miranda joins Olympiacos|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=11 July 2018|accessdate=12 July 2018}} ==International career== Of [[Brazilians|Brazilian descent]],{{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-nos/rio-ave/detalhe/pai-de-roderick-diz-que-o-filho-esta-tranquilo.html|title=Pai de Roderick diz que o filho "está tranquilo"|trans-title=Roderick's father says son "is calm"|newspaper=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|language=pt|date=29 December 2017|accessdate=16 April 2018}} Roderick chose to represent [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] internationally and went on to win 45 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] all youth categories comprised. He represented the [[Portugal national under-20 football team|under-20 team]] at the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2011 FIFA World Cup]] in Colombia, often partnering [[Sporting Clube de Portugal]]'s [[Nuno Reis]] in an eventual runner-up finish.{{cite news|url=https://www.publico.pt/2011/08/22/desporto/noticia/mundial-vai-mudar-pouco-na-vida-imediata-dos-sub20-portugueses-1508644|title=Mundial vai mudar pouco na vida imediata dos sub-20 portugueses|trans-title=World Cup will change little in short-term life of Portugal's under-20|newspaper=[[Público (Portugal)|Público]]|language=pt|date=22 August 2011|accessdate=16 April 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 4 October 2018}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|National Cup !colspan=2|[[League Cup]] !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=5|[[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] |[[2009–10 S.L. Benfica season|2009–10]]For [[Taça da Liga]] third round:
